title: A1466 820-3437
message: This board is a potential refurb for a business client. The only history I have on it is that the screen is cracked and that there is "No Display". Upon further investigating the unit gets a green light and fan spin but does not POST. The computer spins up runs for about 30 seconds and then spins down and repeats over and over again. The computer does have proper 8.58 V PPBUS and has 1.75 VCORE. The VCORE rail cycles with the fan spinning. When the computer is spun up and VCORE is high, there is no light on a USB mouse or keyboard. No signs of liquid damage or previous repair. The CPU gets warm but not alarmingly hot.

title: A1466 820-3437
message: If this happened after a drop and a cracked LCD there is probably damage under the CPU and/or RAM. Impact damage is usually not fixable.

title: A1466 820-3437
message: Is it worth attempting to reflow the CPU / RAM chips with flux?

title: A1466 820-3437
message: If you want to waste time. The traces/pads will probably be ripped up and even if it works I will not consider it a durable or reliable repair.
